comment.text:
Let me start by saying, if an establishment has a line outside waiting to order because there's no seating due to them not being a traditional, "sit-down" restaurant, speaks volumes! When I tell you my pregnant self waited over an hour to order a burger and some fries, I did, and I WILL DO IT AGAIN! LOL!

If you're sensitive to particular or possibly vulgar words, this place isn't for you but the food is amazing! I've never had a vegan burger taste this good! And the fries were shockingly amazing as well. Normally these types of places miss on the fries but no, Pinky Cole didn't miss with this! The food was fulfilling and I was stuffed! My mother in law didn't finish her burger because it was so filling and she got full fast. She enjoyed her burger as well! 

The brand is GENIUS! From the music outside, to the "friendly" customers, to the food, the brand is impeccable like the food!

Go! Wait and go! You can order online if you don't want to wait in line because there's a line. DEFINITELY will be going back!

photos.caption: The Fussy hussy Sandwich and Fries

comment.text:
Went about a week ago. It was a really cold day. I got a fussy hussy no tomato. It was ok at best. I ordered it in the restaurant, went to my car and came back. Nothing seemed freshly cooked and the veggies kind of overpowered the taste of the burger. Not sure if the Pattie's are thinner/smaller, but it seemed different that the first time I tried a year ago at the location by MLK's house. Everything was hot and fresh. I'm not a vegan or vegetarian and I really liked the burger before. Maybe it was an off day. But, I probably won't visit this location again. :(. 

Also, they have that system where they ask for a tip before you make the food. I hate that! How can I tip if I haven't eaten the food or even seen if there was a mistake made. Then they stare at you to see if you're going to tip. It's not a tip, it's like a bribe for them not to eff up the food you paid for!!!

Great food with such a fun experience. Everyone was friendly, the restaurant is really cool. 

If you're going for someone's birthday, you should mention it. What a fun little surprise that was for me!

Slutty Vegan has delicious soul warming food, located off Ralph Davis Abernathy Rd, SW near downtown Atlanta. We stood outside waiting in line for about 30 minutes. A energetic fun spot to grab some of the best burgers in town-Togo. My go-to is the One Night Stand Burger, plant based patty loaded with vegan bacon & veggies. The Ambience was okay. The cashier effortlessly checked us out. We had all the condiments needed for our burgers. Oh and try their yummy Slutty Lemonade & Sweet potato pie! Go check Slutty Vegan out! Excellent place for lunch. Street parking.  Slutty Vegan has different locations in Atlanta, Georgia.

I adore this restaurant with all my heart. I saw a news story about it either on sunday morning or sixty minutes and knew I just had to go. most vegan burger joints try too hard. miss slutty vegan is on a different level. this is the closest thing I've tasted to a real burger in over five years. what makes it even better is the price includes a full meal. burger, fries, and a drink. god bless america and god bless slutty vegan

I am proud to be a slutty vegan!!! That burger NEVER disappoints. The cashier was having a little difficulty with the cash register today, but we waited patiently. I am so glad I did. Their cheeseburger with caramelized onions and cheese with fries (sprinkled with Slut Dust) was WORTH the trip from VA to ATL. Now the ambiance is non existent--it's a walk up counter and the AC was not exactly giving what it needed to give. But it didn't matter because the food surpasses the ambiance anyways. Every time I visit
The ATL, I am glad to get "sluttified"!

I always make it a point to stop at Slutty Vegan when I'm in town. My friend took me to this location. I ended up getting the Super Slut (sans jalapeño) and fries and my friend got the dance hall queen. Food was made to order and came out quick since there wasn't a lot of people there. I tasted the dancehall queen and kind of wish I had gotten that but was told it was too spicy. Oh well, I guess I will have to save it for my next visit!

Wow wow wow wow wow.  

I have been waiting to try Slutty Vegan for over 3 years and I am so happy I finally did. As a vegetarian, it's so hard to find good places like this in South Florida, but we were finally in Atlanta for 2 hours and I said "I have to go to Slutty Vegan"!
The service was great and the young lady taking our order was very kind when helping us choose our order. 

Keep in mind that there is no inside seating so it's more of an order and go type of place. We were so excited we ate it in the car in a parking lot nearby lol. 

I can't wait to one day have Slutty Vegan again! I'm so glad I was able to finally try this spot and will recommend it to everyone who I know that visits Atlanta. 

Vegan/vegetarian or not ..... TRY THIS PLACE OUT PLEASE!

The banana pudding is a must try 10/10
Sweet potato pie? 10/10
Sloppy tippy burger (a little over cooked but still great) 9/10
Heaux boy 9.5/10
Chickn Head 10/10
Fries 9.5/10

Walked in and were greeted with, "Hey Sluts!"  The cashier was patient and knowledgeable about the menu. There was a line (in the rain) but service was fast.

I'm not vegan. This was good food. If all vegan food tastes this good, I'd become a vegan! My group ordered burger, chicken sandwich, and a chili dog. Everything was excellent! 

Please consider opening a location in California!

photos.caption: One Night Stand (tastes better than it looks)

comment.text:
Everything I thought it would be...IT WAS!
Such a unique experience. All of the employees greet you when you come in as a "slut" as apart of the theme of the restaurant. Service was 5 stars. Once I got home, the burger was delicious. I omitted the slut sauce because it's Mayo based. Sweet potato fries and slut fries are well seasoned and delicious. I also purchased a sweet potato pie that was yummy! This location is small but the vibe and music while waiting inside and outside was cool. The wait time was over what I thought it would be (30 mins) but definitely was worth it!

photos.caption: Dancehall Queen Burger with no slut sauce
Dancehall Queen Burger Slutty Fries Sweet potato fries

comment.text:
I have heard a lot about the Slutty Vegan and had to give a  shot when I found out that their food truck was paying a visit.  The food was fine, there was an aficionado in line with me an she said this is the best vegan burger and tastes real close to the real thing.  

I had the sloppy toppy and one night stand.  I would say it was fine but not the best vegan I have had.  The patty's were a little rubbery and lacked some char.  The fries were very good.  The service was great and with a smile.

photos.caption: Giving the food truck a try.  Heard good things
One night stand and sloppy toppy

comment.text: It was ok. But I love what Pinky is doing with her brand.  I am not vegan but I dabble.

A few times before, I've had the Sloppy Toppy & One Night Stand, but I always come back to mi amor, the Ménage A Trois!  It's definitely my favorite and was a hit with my sis and niece also.

We went by the Edgewood location first, but parking was too difficult after two spins around the block. The Abernathy location is where I always go anyway, so we ended up there with a little more parking options.

We were greeted very warmly, and the wait wasn't long.

photos.caption: Ménage A Trois   *ignore my nails ; they distracted me too *

comment.text:
Stopped by Slutty Vegan for a late night snack I ordered the one night stand with beyond me and it was very good. I couldn't really taste the bacon while I ate the burger but when I eat the bacon alone, it was really flavorful and surprisingly good. I thought the burger and the fries were good and tasted fresh.   

The inside is pretty small, but big enough for you to step in place your order wait, and then grab your food and go. They have some items for sale in the waiting area. The person who took our order was cool with us, but it seems like the next person was given an attitude when he asked for extra fries not sure what that was all about but I found it was unnecessary.

No parking lot, we found street parking around the back on the residential street.

If you heard the hype... BELIEVE IT! This spot is a cool vibe and I love how they make eating vegan fun. There's something on the menu for everyone. The music was great and the customer service was on point. 

Parking for this spot was odd, I had to find a spot behind the restaurant and I wasn't sure if I would get a ticket or not... thankfully I didn't!

Everything was so good l was even enticed to purchase merchandise and dessert. If you haven't been here yet, go!

Second time visiting Slutty Vegan in Atlanta and this time I tried the One Night Stand. It's similar to the Hussy Fussy, which was the first burger I had at Slutty Vegan, but has vegan bacon on it instead of pickles. The vegan bacon made a big difference so now it's a favorite! As always the slutty fries are amazing! The slutty dust seasoning takes the fries to another level! You really don't need anything on it as it is sooooo good by itself. The banana pudding was okay but I feel like it's hard to create a vegan version so expectations can only be so high. Looking forward to visiting again whether in ATL or another one of their locations.

I don't recommend eating here. The quality is not up to standards.This vegan restaurant has wandering roaches everywhere I looked. The service is also poor, and the prices are high considering they have a known Roach infestation, it is unacceptable. 

Yes, the female employee said while processing my return, "We are handling the roaches (baby Roach dead on the counter by the register smh) Every restaurant in this area has roaches." I said this is a health code violation . " She stated we are handling the roaches. I understand why you want your money back. 

 The atmosphere was unpleasant, and the restaurant was understaffed. Overall, the experience was very disappointing.  

Calling customers sluts upon entry is slander and defamation of character.

Defamation of character is a tort that occurs when a person makes a statement that causes another person to be ridiculed, embarrassed, or held in contempt. In this case, the restaurant's staff made a negative comment about a customer's character, which constitutes defamation of character. 

What is slander ? Slander is a false statement that is spoken or published which causes damage to a third party's reputation, and is a type of defamation. The restaurant's staff's comment was false and damaging to the customer's reputation, making it a form of slander.

Name calling such as "bitch", "whore" , "slut"  is sexual harrassment and establishes hostile work environment. According to the office of equal opportunity, 

 Sexual harassment is a form of discrimination that is illegal in the workplace and it includes any unwanted verbal or physical conduct of a sexual nature. Name calling is a form of verbal abuse that is intended to humiliate (customers) or intimidate someone, and it is considered a form of sexual harassment.

Possibilities : Any restaurant was understaffed, which could mean that the staff IS not able to keep up with cleaning and maintaining the restaurant. This lack of cleanliness can lead to many issues, including roaches, which can harm humans. 

 What are roaches ? Roaches are a type of insect that is usually found in damp and dark areas. They are known to carry bacteria and other germs, and can cause allergies and asthma attacks. They can also cause structural damage to buildings and contaminate food.

 Again : Roaches also cause a variety of health issues, including asthma and allergies. Therefore, if your company knows roaches infest on its premises, you could not be liable for lawsuits 

My honest notion, rebrand and stop slandering customers and respect them and get rid of the roaches. This company makes a significant amount of cash flow to temporary close to treat and handle roaches properly. Otherwise they become household (restaurant) pets?

This is not to shame a black owned business. 
Honest review.

photos.caption: My receipt requesting for refund because the roach infestation
Roaches    roach droppings   Will upload more photos
Driving off, long line and to have roaches  ‍  Told them they have roaches, guess they have to see for themselves?
My receipt requesting for refund because the roach infestation

comment.text: So the name was intriguing, but I had some issues. The first thing is the full menu is not available everyday and is not advertised that way. The vegan shrimp is only available on Friday's and they only offer canned drinks, not the fresh lemonade that's on the online menu. The service is good though and the staff speak to you similar to Cane's. The burger was interesting with different flavors and their signature slutty sauce. Overall, I'm on the fence if I would go back.

photos.caption: One Night Stand burger with fries

comment.text: Yummy fun spot. Very limited seating. Conveniently located. Staff has great service and vibes. A little pricey

If you are looking for vegan options and in the mood for a fast food burger, then definitely try Slutty Vegan in Atlanta. I chose the One Night Stand. It is a plant based patty, vegan cheese and bacon, caramelized onions, lettuce, tomatoes, their special slut sauce, anda vegan Hawaiian bun. It was absolutely delicious The crinkle fries are sprinkled with their slut dust. I also tried the vegan sweet potato pie. It was very flavorful and tasty. The workers are friendly and energetic. Just a warning, if you're hypersensitive then they may get a slut shout-out. The sandwiches have unique names like sloppy toppy, menage a trois, fussy hussy, and super slut. This particular location is only set up for takeout. You can also order ahead and pick up.

I loooove this place. My food was ready sooner than the expected time of 30 minutes and it was very fresh. I ordered the Dancehall Queen and had it for late lunch and dinner. The staff is attentive and kind at every location I go to. It's close to where I work so I'll be coming here for lunch. Truly one of the best fast food options metro-atl.

This is a must! There was a huge line but it was worth the wait. 

We came with non-vegans and they really enjoyed this place also. From the burgers, to the fries, to the dessert.. *chef's kiss*

I had the ménage a trois and it was everything that I hoped it would be. I usually go for the strangest/most creative option in the menu and this was it.

It had a vegan patty, vegan bacon, and vegan shrimp - I mean, how could you pass up on that? The picture doesn't do it justice.

My boyfriend got the dancehall queen and wow, delicious and didn't disappoint. It had sweet plantains!

It's worth the line and the hype - trust me!

Attention Sluts!  As the first brick and mortar location of the Slutty Vegan chain, they have stayed efficient, maintain excellent customer service, and have stayed true to the brand! 

Love this location. Stop by and get sluttified! #FussyHussy

I really LOVE the food. It is overpriced and I get it, the food is healthy. That is of money to pay, and you DO not to FILL up on the fries! That is wrong. 

Music is so loud that it is very hard to place your order. Please remember that not all of your customers are 30 and under. We don't need to turn up all the time.

OMG so delicious We had Hollywood
Hookers and tried all four sauces with
our slutty fries. Dang if those aren't
the best fries we've ever had! We
should have ordered more. Parking
was on the street 1/2 block away.
Music was way too loud, even for a
half deaf old person, but those young
ones will find out what harm that does
like we did. No seating, so we drive off
only to pull off into a neighborhood to
eat in the car while those fries were
still hot!

photos.caption: Chomping a fry while opening the goods!

comment.text:
I am a huge fan of burgers in general,
regardless of plant-based. 
Beef, pork, plant....a good burger is a yummy burger and this is a yummy burger packed with flavor.
I treated two of my cousins to lunch and both times, once at the original restaurant, once at the food truck, they indicated they liked the selection and flavor. All that was missing from our visits were non-dairy shakes!
Thanks for making us classic tasting burgers and fries meals while we visited.
Cheers!

Im not from ATL but I see so many people go to this place and rave over it so I had to try it. First I got the chilli and it was really tasty. I got the 12oz and the only thing I can say is that it still seemed a bit small. I then got the fussy hussy burger and it was good also but the fries were banging. Best fries I've ever had. The service is also amazing here. I love the way they greet you when coming in. I'd absolutely go back when in ATL again!

The food here is delicious. The service is lightning fast, and the employees are light and fun. If this is your first time going, let them know and they will make some awesome recommendations.  I had the one night stand with pickles added. I also had the fussy hussy. Both were soooo good !!! Shout out Shamar ( hopefully I spelled his name correctly) he made some awesome recommendations!! Please bring this slut to Cali!!!

Solid vegan junk food options in an extremely casual, fast food setting that only offers counter service. The service was about why you'd expect for fast food and it was a little pricey but it was definitely an experience. Check it out.
Went a few years back when the burgers were bigger and better. Cool experience. Probably would not wait in line for it again. Hits the spot when you want a good vegan fast food burger

When you first walk through the door you will be greeted as a slut and on your way out saluted as a slut. If you can not take this dark humor then you may want to grow some thick skin before you walk in . 3rd tune coming to the place and it buss every time. Got the ménage a trois and one night stand most recently. One of the best food places you can choose, fries are seasoned and burgers are. You can't miss

photos.caption: One night stand w vegan bacon

comment.text: No one compares. Food is fire! Go see for yourself and thank me later. They don't miss!

I'm not a vegan, by any means but this
place definitely made me consider it.

Flavor, creativity, quality, and value.
I spent $95 bucks for the family and 
don't regret sending one penny.

The best banana pudding I've ever had.
I will be returning on the regular.

So I've been to Atlanta several times in the past few years, and I've always forgotten to stop by one of the locations to try it out and see what the hype was all about. I finally made it this past weekend and I wasn't necessarily disappointed, and would recommend it. However, I have a few caveats regarding the location I went too. 

1. For starters, I wasn't too comfortable being called a "slut" as I entered the building and neither were the mature ladies that came in behind me. 

2. My bill was $50+ for 5 items and two of the items were water. And speaking of water, they sold it as slut water on the menu but when I received them, they were your basic Smart water looking plastic containers that you can get anywhere. See pictures below. How about a "slut water" label? 

3. Although the food, especially the burger was delicious , it looked nothing like the menu burger for $18. 

4. The burger and the shrimp were pretty saucy, referred too as "slut sauce", so I was concerned I'd regret it later on with an upset stomach. Fortunately my stomach was able to tolerate it, but my passenger was unhappy with the amount of gas it produced if you know what I mean.  

5. This particular location was on the corner of some gentrified neighborhood so there was minimal parking and I could see the residents unhappy with folks parking in front of their homes to walk up the street for fast Vegan food. *My suggestion* either minimize the amount of locations you are opening which will help justify the "limited edition" prices. And / Or place them in black communities so your at least not only "giving back" to the community from which y'all have come from, and maybe even combat some of the chain fast Food restaurants and liquor stores that are hurting the black communities health wise. 

6. According to the Slutty Vegan website, they pride themselves in being black/woman owned. I can appreciate that, knowing there aren't enough black business owners in America in the food industry. But limiting it to black women only minimizes it's potential I feel. As a black man, I immediately thought of 2 locations where this Slutty Vegan idea would prosper. But I'm not a woman so the ideas will have to remain internal. ‍

7. I read that Slutty Vegan uses "impossible burgers" which is concerning because the meat is made from genetically engineered soy protein and genetically engineered yeast called heme which bleeds, and banned in Europe.  Not too mention, impossible meats is founded and owned by Patrick O. Brown which is sorta contradictory too their prideful slogan of being "Black Woman" owned. Patrick Brown is a white man. *My Suggestion* Seek out a black woman or man at one of the prominent culinary art schools here in American and create your own vegan burger and shrimp recipes. And with the fries, seek out a Black investor with some land and grow your own potatoes and produce. "Food deserts" are a real thing. Some one like Tyler Perry whom is in Georgia already with lots of land and $$$ who would probably be happy to contribute. 

8. Lastly, I was visiting from 2 states over, there were no souvenirs being sold at this location; like t-shirts or hats that I could bring back. Disappointing and lost sales opportunities.

As I stated earlier, the food was delicious, the water was regular though, but I would still recommend everyone should try it at least once if your near any of their locations. I would actually go again, but I wouldn't go out of my way for it. I can get all the ingredients particularly the impossible meats and water from Whole Foods for under $50.

photos.caption: No seating, no real drink, and no tip. $59.81 for 1 person might be a little excessive. Or could be inflation.

comment.text: This is a Sloppy Toppy burger I ordered from 476 Edgewater Ave., Atlanta, GA was HORRIBLE. I will never order from this location again. I was vey disappointed; the burgwr was flat burnt and it tasted awful. I make an appoint when I come to visit Atlanta to patronize the Slutty Vegan locations but I will never go back to that particular location. I will  just stick with the Jonesboro location it's way better.
Great location. Hard to find parking but ordered the sloppy toppy and fries and it tasted so good! Can't wait to try new menu items! Everyone was so friendly and the location is so cute!!

This place is so good. I hope this franchise keeps growing! (My opinion) The food is filling , flavorful. The language and theme is hilarious, when it's your first time going expect a cute, funny, freaky shout out . 

I'd give this place 10 stars if I could. More than the food, I respect what Pinky has done / is doing so far.
Garbage food, absolutely disgusting and inedible.  Horrible business.  This business will fail.
I loved the food. I had ordered one night stand. It tasted better than real me! The only downside is that there's not many places to sit.
I walked in and there was hardly a line. I received my order in about 5 minutes and it was worth all the hype.

I love Slutty Vegan! This is a black-owned business that serves delicious and flavorful vegan food. The menu has a variety of options, from burgers and sandwiches to fries and salads. Everything is made with fresh and quality ingredients, and the portions are generous. The staff is super friendly and welcoming, and they greet everyone who walks in with a smile. The atmosphere is fun and lively, and the music is always on point. This is a great place to enjoy a satisfying and guilt-free meal with friends or family. Slutty Vegan is a must-try for vegans and non-vegans alike!

We stood outside for 30 minutes, the guy working the front kept telling us we can't come inside because they're at max capacity yet still allowed people to keep cutting in front of us. They were rude and didn't care who came and went but would not let us come in. There were 7 people outside waiting. 
I am appalled at how this place is ran and how unfriendly their staff are. This place may have great food but I hope you get better staff. Your customers are the ones who support your business. After this experience I will not be back. I've never been treated this way before.
This place was bomb! The hamburger was awesome and they nailed the texture of the shrimp! Fries were seasoned. I will definitely be going back to try the chicken!

This was my first visit to this location and I wasn't impressed. I've only been to the jonesboro location besides this one, so I was shocked they didn't have some of the same beverages. I do understand with the location, but I will say the food had great seasoning. I brought a friend who wanted to get a taste, and for the amount of time we waited on our food it wasn't hot. The service was acceptable for the time of night we came, but they weren't as vocal with their slutty greetings. They were intentional in giving us a wait time while we waited for our food and handling the customers professionally while we awaited our food. I loved the design of the location and it's perfect for a photo whenever you come to get Slutty! I had the super slit and I loved the flavors of guac and Jalapeño. You can't miss me with fries, but be cautious that you are charged more for sweet potatoes. I believe they're called side heauxs. Either way, I'll be back for another round at another time for the vibe.

photos.caption: The Super slut Sandwich & the sweet potato fries.

comment.text: Traveled from Cleveland, Ohio to try a Ménage a trios Slutty Vegan burger and it did not disappoint!! Worth the wait in line (12min wait). Everyone inside had great energy! Ive tried meatless burgers before and they were NOT good but this burger was really delicious!! No after taste and to be honest I couldn't tell the difference. The burger even had a grilled taste. Great experience!! I would come back again

We tried the One Night Stand, Hollywood Hooker, and the banana pudding. I did prefer the one night stand with beyond meat substitute (the sauce is ). Kept the Hooker sandwhich as is, but it felt a bit heavy. The sandwich orders came with fries (they were delicious). 

Definitely try the banana pudding. It's pretty sweet so I took small bites, but each one was bursting with flavor to satisfy. 

It's a little messy and a bit pricey for what you get (but I'd definitely get the one night stand and banana pudding again, probably just not a routine food spot) 

The vibe is is pretty awesome and lively (but not much seating area).

The outside looks like a hole in the wall but with some bomb slogans.  You walk in and the music and atmosphere makes you want to party.  You can either pull up the menu on your phone via barcode or choose from the wall.  It's all to go as there are no tables (something they should consider) but the j young lady that takes your order is fucking amazing. She is the shits with her words and will have you cracking up.  They are having such a good time with their jobs and their customers.  You feel right at home.  There are several different burgers to choose from.  I chose the one night stand with bacon and tomato.   Fawk.... felt like an orgasm in my mouth.  Fortunately for us by the time our food was ready the one table that they do have was empty so we grabbed it and partied while we ate
  
They also have drinks for your delectable taste and memorabilia for you to purchase. 

Don't miss out on this place if your looking for a bomb ass Vegan Burger Place.

I ordered my meal online to avoid standing in line but when got there, I noticed a very efficient practice. I love how the employees would engage with people in line and call people in when there is enough space to get inside (this location is very small, only enough to cook and grab orders). And of course the food was delicious! I can't wait to get back!

photos.caption: The Fussy hussy Sandwich And Slutty Fries

comment.text:
As I ate my Slutty Vegan burgers and chicken sandwich, I kept thinking in my head how do they make plant-based, vegan beef, bacon, chicken, and cheese taste so "authentic" and good? If someone had purchased Slutty Vegan's burgers for me and didn't tell me they were vegan, I'm not sure I'd have been able to tell the difference. However, I probably *would* have been able to tell with the chicken sandwich because of the "chicken's" texture. It was noticeably different from standard chicken sandwich filet meat, with a more uniform, spongy consistency. That said, I still thought Slutty Vegan's chicken sandwich was satisfying and I'd order it again.

Slutty Vegan started out as a food truck in August 2018. The business specializes in vegan fast food. More specifically, they specialize in fast-food-style vegan burgers and sandwiches.

They opened their first brick-and-mortar location (this location) on Ralph David Abernathy Blvd in the Westview neighborhood of southwest Atlanta in January 2019. Since then, they've opened two additional metro Atlanta locations in Jonesboro (July 2020), south of the city, and on Edgewood Ave in Old Fourth Ward (October 2020). At the time of writing this review, a fourth Atlanta-area location is on the way.

Slutty Vegan is popular. Long lines for the food truck and outside the restaurants are a common sight. For this original location on Ralph David Abernathy, the inside of the restaurant is very small so most customers have to wait outside. This helps make the line out the door appear long.

When I posted pictures of my Slutty Vegan meal on social media, multiple people asked me how long my wait was. When I arrived around 6:10pm on a Wednesday, after it had just stopped raining, there were only two people in front of me (and one of them had already placed his order and was just picking up). I think I got lucky.

The restaurant doesn't have dedicated parking, but street parking around the restaurant is free. This is a tiny place with no indoor nor outdoor seating. It's takeout-only, which was fortuitous when the COVID-19 pandemic hit. There's one way in and one way out. They had both doors propped open during my visit to maximize ventilation. If you didn't wear a mask, you couldn't enter. They sprayed hand sanitizer into every customer's hands upon entry. One register, one pickup counter.

Slutty Vegan's menu offerings can change daily so be sure to check their Instagram feed for the current day's menus: https://www.instagram.com/sluttyveganatl/.

When I visited, there were six burgers priced at $13-15 each. I noticed the online menu, which showed their full lineup (11 burgers, sandwiches, and a plant-based bratwurst), had slightly more expensive prices for some items. For example, in person, both the Sloppy Toppy and Fussy Hussy were $13 each, but the online menu showed them at $15 each.

Here's what I got:

* One Night Stand ($15) - plant-based patty loaded with vegan bacon, vegan cheese, caramelized onions, lettuce, tomato, and Slutty Vegan's Slut Sauce on a vegan Hawaiian bun
* Super Slut ($15) - plant-based patty loaded with guacamole, jalapeños, vegan cheese, caramelized onions, lettuce, tomato, and Slutty Vegan's Slut Sauce on a vegan Hawaiian bun
* Chik'N Head ($15) - plant-based chicken tossed in buffalo sauce topped with pickles, vegan ranch and coleslaw on a vegan Hawaiian bun
* Skinny Dippers ($6) - NOLA-style fried pickles with blackberry mayo sauce
* Slutty Fries (one cup of fries was included with each burger) - French fries with signature Slut Dust

First, they forgot my blackberry mayo sauce that was supposed to come with the Skinny Dippers. That was disappointing. I was looking forward to trying it.

In general, the food was yummy. The burgers and chicken sandwich tasted just like regular fast food; the beef more so than the chicken. While the vegan bacon in the One Night Stand didn't have the same crispy texture as real bacon, it definitely had that familiar smoky flavor and then some. I was surprised. As is typical with fast food chains, the burgers/sandwich didn't look as good in real life as they did online, but that was OK because they tasted satisfying. The Skinny Dippers were among the best fried pickles I've had, though salty like the rest.

The restaurant has a fun atmosphere. When I was there, the friendly cashier Julianne B announced each customer and where they were from over the loudspeaker. The music was turned up like In Da Club. Inside, there's only enough room to stand in line. There's an open kitchen so you can watch the staff prepare burgers while you wait.

I placed my order at 6:15pm and was in my car and driving off by 6:27pm, so the turnaround time was reasonable. Along with the orders of the people physically in front of me, the kitchen was working on online orders as well.

TL;DR - I think Slutty Vegan is worth it if you've never tried it before. It's unique and tasty. For me, I'd never had vegan fast food like this before until now.

comment.text:
Slutty Vegan ATL is an extremely famous Vegan burger joint known for its delicious plant-based burgers! They have over 351K followers on Instagram and they are known for being a hip take-out joint without the usage of any meat! Slutty Vegan does not have any dine-in options, and you should always expect a line at Slutty Vegan! 

We came on a rainy day so the line wasn't that bad, but apparently it can be as bad as 60+ minutes, so it' always important to plan accordingly! Our wait was fortunately only around 20 minutes. 

Once you reach the front of the line, you are able to see some Slutty Vegan merchandise, such as Slutty Strips--which are vegan bacon that can be purchased.

We decided to order 
"One Night Stand"
"Chick'N Head" 
..which all come with a side from fries!
Upon ordering, we were invited into the restaurant to see how these plant-based burgers were being cooked!

One Night Stand - "Plant-based patty loaded with vegan bacon, vegan cheese, caramelized onions, lettuce, tomato, and our Slut Sauce on a vegan Hawaiian bun" // This seems to be their signature burger, so we decided to get it. Upon our first bite, I seriously looked at the burger and I said "this isn't meat?!" It tasted like a hamburger from Five Guys or something. The patty was so tender and juicy, and the bacon tasted just like meat as well. I was actually extremely impressed with the burger and it really hit the spot! The vegan cheese also tasted just like cheese... Man how the world has changed.. Even vegetarians and vegans can enjoy a burger now! On the other hand...

Chik'N Head - "Plant-based chicken tossed in buffalo sauced topped with pickles, vegan ranch and cole slaw on a vegan Hawaiian bun" // We wanted to try something different besides the typical hamburger, so we were debating between Heaux Boy (vegan shrimp burger) and chick'n head, but unfortunately, they did not have Heaux Boy on the menu. I personally do not recommend this burger. The chicken texture isn't as tender and real like a plant-based patty. It kinda had a rubbery texture and the chicken patty was extremely peppery. It didn't taste bad, but it did not exactly have the authentic chicken feel to it. While it was mildly disappointing, the flavor of the burger was still pretty decent!
The fries did not disappoint either, and it the "slut dust" which seems like their signature seasoning also complimented the fries very well!

Overall, Slutty Vegan ATL was definitely a special experience. Will I be back? Hell yeah. I want to try the other burgers on the menu as well as the Heaux Boy! Hopefully, the texture won't be as bad as the vegan chicken. I am looking forward to it. I know many of you guys want to check out Slutty Vegan, and I DEFINITELY think you should check it out! It's really worth visiting!!!
